August 28, 1983: Fiction
THE NAME OF THE ROSE, by Umberto Eco. (Helen & Kurt Wolff/Harcourt Brace
Jovanovich,$15.95.) Unraveling the mystery of a murder in a 14th-century Italian
monastery.
RETURN OF THE JEDI, adapted by Joan D. Vinge. (Random House, $6.95.)
Illustrated storybook based on the latest ''Star Wars'' film.
AUGUST, by Judith Rossner. (Houghton Mifflin, $15.95.) The five-year
relationship of two women, a teen-age patient and her analyst.
HOLLYWOOD WIVES, by Jackie Collins. (Simon & Schuster, $16.95.) The
struggle for money and power in Tinsel Town.
THE SEDUCTION OF PETER S., by Lawrence Sanders. (Putnam, $15.95.) The
sudden, danger-filled success of a long-out-of-work actor.
THE LITTLE DRUMMER GIRL, by John le Carr√©. (Knopf, $15.95.) A British
actress caught between agents of Israeli intelligence and of the Palestine
Liberation Organization.
CHRISTINE, by Stephen King. (Viking, $16.95.) A car that kills is at large among a
Pennsylvania town's high school set.
GODPLAYER, by Robin Cook. (Putnam, $13.95.) The marriage of two physicians
crumbles as death stalks their hospital's corridors.
HEARTBURN, by Nora Ephron. (Knopf, $11.95.) A roman a clef about a marriage
breaking up.
WHITE GOLD WIELDER, by Stephen R. Donaldson. (Del Rey/Ballantine, $14.95.)
Book Three of ''The Second Chronicles of Thomas Covenant,'' a fantasy saga.
THE SUMMER OF KATYA, by Trevanian. (Crown, $12.95.) A love story with dark
family secrets, set in France before World War I.
ASCENT INTO HELL, by Andrew M. Greeley. (Bernard Geis/Warner, $16.50.) The
ordeal of a man who leaves the priesthood.
VOICE OF THE HEART, by Barbara Taylor Bradford. (Doubleday, $17.95.) The
friendship of two women survives the strains of 25 years in the worlds of show
business, politics and big business.
ANCIENT EVENINGS, by Norman Mailer. (Little, Brown, $19.95.) Ten centuries of
rites and orgies in long-ago Egypt.
EXOCET, by Jack Higgins. (Stein & Day, $14.95.) A beautiful woman torn
between men on opposite sides of the Falklands War.
August 28, 1983
Non-Fiction
IN SEARCH OF EXCELLENCE, by Thomas J. Peters and Robert H. Waterman Jr.
(Harper &Row, $19.95.) Lessons to be learned from well-run American
corporations.
THE ONE MINUTE MANAGER, by Kenneth Blanchard and Spencer Johnson.
(Morrow, $15.) How to increase the productivity of those with whom you work, as
well as your own.
MEGATRENDS, by John Naisbitt. (Warner, $15.50.) Predictions about America in
the next decade based on an analysis of conditions today.
CREATING WEALTH, by Robert G. Allen. (Simon & Schuster, $14.95.) Making
money in real estate.
OUT ON A LIMB, by Shirley MacLaine. (Bantam, $15.95.) The actress tells of her
mid-life ''journey to find her true self.''
JANE FONDA'S WORKOUT BOOK, by Jane Fonda. (Simon & Schuster, $19.95.)
An exercise book for women, seasoned with the film star's philosophy of physical
well-being.
BLUE HIGHWAYS, by William Least Heat Moon. (Atlantic/Little, Brown, $17.50.) A
report on a trip through the back roads of America.
THE PRICE OF POWER, by Seymour M. Hersh.(Summit, $19.95.) A critical look
at Henry Kissinger's years in the Nixon White House.
GROWING UP, by Russell Baker. (Congdon & Weed, $15.) The New York Times
columnist recalls his boyhood and youth.
THE LAST LION, by William Manchester. (Little, Brown, $25.) Winston S.
Churchill's ''visions of glory,'' 1874-1932.
HOW TO LIVE TO BE 100 - OR MORE, by George Burns. (Putnam, $11.95.) The
octogenarian comedian's ''ultimate diet, sex and exercise book.''
NOTHING DOWN, by Robert G. Allen. (Simon &Schuster, $16.95.) How to buy
real estate with little or no money: a 1980 book.
WORKING OUT, by Charles Hix. (Simon & Schuster, $16.95.) Exercise book for
men.
THE F-PLAN DIET, by Audrey Eyton. (Crown, $12.95.) Americanized version of a
popular English fiber-based regimen.
HOW TO SATISFY A WOMAN EVERY TIME, by Naura Hayden. (Bibli O'Phile/
Dutton, $7.95.) Advice from a television and radio personality.
